lenders.name: Rodney Howard
lenders.loan_because:
What God Wants Us to Hear by Rodney Howard Browne

Put simply, stick with the evangelizing plan God has sure to praise and use. Don't try and be so creative and adorable that folks miss the truth. No need for unintelligible and crazy substitutes that entertain but barely convict the lost and edify the saved. Will you notice something here? This exhortation isn't addressed to the hearer, it's for the spokesman.

The person that is to do that's the one exclaiming the message. Be ready to do it in season and out of season. Don't get on up and begin with an apology that you didn't quite have sufficient time to prepare.

That doesn't wash." And do so faithfully when it's convenient and when it's not. Sadly , in a shocking number of churches today, God's people are being told what they have to hear rather than what they have to hear. A watered-down gospel may attract gigantic crowds ( for some considerable time ), but it has no never-ending impact. I can't say I have been capable of finding any place in the Scriptures where God expresses the least bit of doubt for drawing numbers.

Enjoyable the curious itching ears of our postmodern audiences is an exercise in futility.

Frankly , I'm going to resume doing exactly that, by God's grace, until the day He calls me home. And I think there is a fast-increasing number of supporters who long for nutritive messages based on the Word of the Lord Almighty not human standpoint. The world urgently needs more Christians with the fervor and faith of Paul. Will you be one of them? Will you reply the charge? If this is the case there's no better time than now to start.  

Read more about Rodney Howard Browne on these sites:

http://www.yapperz.com/view_profile.php?member_id=3834
http://goodnewsamerica.piczo.com/post/10705/Rodney+Howard+Browne?cr=3
http://ww4.yuwie.com/profile/?id=994771

lenders.name: Dragonladies.org
lenders.loan_because:
I am happy to help people who are willing to work, and help themselves.
I'm disheartened by the seemingly overwhelming numbers of internet scammers from certain Asian countries.    I loan to help as a reminder that dishonest people are only a small fraction of the population of these countries, and the honest people who are willing to work will make good use of a modest amount of help.
Please don't assume any connection to the people we lend money to via Kiva, with the scammers reported on our site.
The loans we make, and success rate in repayment demonstrate it's possible to make a living, honestly, even in difficult times and locations.
Thank you, and good luck to all Kiva participants!     
You can help change the world, with loans...not handouts!
lenders.occupational_info:
I maintain a website which focuses on internet romance scams, from Asia.    We seek to educate and inform the public, help victims, and expose scams and scammers.
Please never send money to somebody you only know from the internet.....except to LEND money through Kiva!

Be a treasure to the poor, an admonisher to the rich, an answerer to the cry of the needy, a preserver of the sanctity of thy pledge. Be fair in thy judgment, and guarded in thy speech. Be unjust to no man, and show all meekness to all men. Be as a lamp unto them that walk in darkness, a joy to the sorrowful, a sea for the thirsty, a haven for the distressed, an upholder and defender of the victim of oppression. " From the writings of the Baha'i Faith

lenders.loan_because: Trying to make the world a better place.  Microfinance can affect many lives.
lenders.occupational_info: Construction of affordable and sustainable buildings.

lenders.name: Cherry Hills Christian
lenders.loan_because: We loan because we feel God's calling to bless others around the world. We held a "Break Dress Code" day and students brought in a minimum of $2.00 each to be out of dress code for a day. We raised over $1675 and have sent the funds onto Kiva. We are excited to watch the money we raised work to help bless others.

lenders.name: Trey
lenders.occupation: Minister to Students and Young Adults

lenders.name: Angela
lenders.loan_because: I do whatever Josh and Chuck order me to do:)

lenders.name: Thorkil

lenders.occupational_info: I am in school to get my master's of arts in teaching degree.  I am also a fine arts photographer.

lenders.name: Larry
lenders.loan_because: I am fortunate to be able to help others achieve their goals.

lenders.name: brenda
lenders.loan_because: It is amazing to me the small amount of money that I would spend on a family meal, could actually mean a business venture for someone.  I think its incredible and I want to help people suceed in obtaining their goal as a successful business person.  No one is looking for a hand out, but for a hand up.  I think its great.
lenders.occupational_info: I assist lawyers with their day to day work.  Filing papers in court rooms and in Washington.

lenders.name: Ryo
lenders.loan_because: I have always appreciated all the help I have received from people. If it wasn't for them I wouldn't have been able to get this far. I am glad to be able to give back.

lenders.loan_because: I owned my own business. I know how helpful a loan can be.
lenders.occupational_info: I am retired now but I used to install heating and air conditioning systems.

lenders.name: Jordan

lenders.occupational_info: I work many different jobs, because I love people, teaching, and Hard work :)

lenders.name: Jacqueline & Paul
lenders.loan_because: My sister and brother-in-law gave us $100 this past Christmas, with a challenge to 'make a difference in someone's life'....and here we are!

lenders.name: Amy
lenders.loan_because: I am blessed enough to be able to give back.

lenders.occupational_info: I maintain and build the computers and software that runs a group of local hospitals and medical clinics.

lenders.name: Teddy
lenders.loan_because: it makes a difference in someone's life.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in education, helping teachers unlock the potential of their students to change the world around them.

lenders.occupational_info: I am a college student.

lenders.name: Robert Knapp

lenders.occupational_info: For paid work, I write software for hospitals. Outside of that, I volunteer in an adult education program. lenders.name: Kate
lenders.loan_because: we need to cut out the big banks and governmental strings which are traditionally attached to aid from the west to LDCs.  Doing it this way means that the money goes where it's needed.  Also, small businesses are more integrated into their local community and far less likely to be damaging to the environment than big multi-national companies, and that is very important to me
lenders.occupational_info: I work for a charity which protects biodiversity (plants, animals and habitats) in the north of england.
